intro: Manulea rhodesiana, commonly known as the Rhodesian manulea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically arranged in clusters, often in shades of red or purple. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or grassland habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely known outside of its native region.
